title: American_Top_40_1976_May_1st
description:
"Three hours once a week with AT40 and you know where your favorite songs are on the national music scene. My name is Casey Kasem and the countdown doesn't stop until we get to number one."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

We hear how Al Wilson (at number 37 with "I've Got A Feeling") got his first chart single as a result of believing in a con-artist.

Casey tells about the first song ever to be a hit 3 times under 3 different titles by 3 artists, and plays a bit of each one.

Fleetwood Mac is at number 22 with their song "Rhiannon." Casey tells the story of this mythical woman who was accused of killing her own son.

A listener writes in to ask, "What group that has hit the top 40 during the rock era has the most members?" Casey says this group has been on the radio for the past 47 years.

Another listener wants to know what hit song from a motion picture stayed on the chart the longest. Casey says it was the title song for a movie that featured over a hundred big name movie stars.
